title: Egg Crepes in Broth
introduction: Scrippelle 'mbusse, a delightful dish from the Abruzzo region of Italy, features delicate egg crepes filled with grated cheese, gently rolled, and then served in a warm, comforting broth. This dish, a beautiful union of simplicity and flavor, highlights the elegance of traditional Italian cuisine.
ingredients: 8 cups homemade Chicken Broth or a mix of half store-bought broth and half water
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh Italian flat-leaf parsley
instructions: 1. Prepare the broth, if necessary. Then, prepare the crepes, if necessary. Sprinkle each crepe with some of the cheese and parsley. Roll up the crepes to form tubes. Have ready 6 heated soup bowls. Place 2 tubes in each bowl.
2. If not hot, heat the broth until simmering. Spoon the hot broth onto the crepe tubes and serve immediately.
